Users should create an incident using self-service, however, a specific email address can be provided. The email address can be used to email issues to the instance. An incident record is created automatically on behalf of the sender. If the incident is raised by another system, but direct integration does not exist, the same approach is applied.

When an incident is created from an incoming email, the fields are populated as follows:

 Field Value
 Caller User who sent the email.
 Short description Subject of the email.
 State Set to New.
 Description Contains the body of the email.
 Contact type Set to Email.
 Assignment group Set to Service Desk.


 You can review and update the inbound email actions on incident table that creates incident from incoming email.

false e667219c25513200964f48ca4b89e8c3 incident_from_incoming_email /sysevent_in_email_action_list.do?sysparm_query=table%3Dincident%5EnameLIKECreate%20Incident 3 1 false true There are two inbound actions on the incident table, which can be used to create an incident from incoming email:

  • Create Incident
  • Create Incident (Forwarded)

Update both inbound actions so that the following fields are updated accordingly:

 Field Value 
 Description Populated from the email body.
 Assignment Group Set to Service Desk.
 State State field should be updated instead of the Incident State field.
 
Note: If you do not need to create incidents from incoming emails, disable both inbound actions.
 
To configure inbound email actions based on recommendations:
  1. Navigate to System Policy > Email > Inbound Actions > Create Incident.
  2. Update the script to set fields values based on values in an incoming email.
  3. Ensure Email receiving is enabled in Email Properties.
